bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, August 19, 1925

div1.p: Russell encloses a letter from Noguchi about the transmission of yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, August 19, 1925
div1.opener:
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
-----
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
WILBUR A. SAWYER, M.D.
DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC HEALTH
LABORATORY SERVICE
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
OF
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “INTERCOM”
MEMBERS
-----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
JOHN G. FITZGERALD
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
NORMA S. THOMPSON
SECRETARY
YELLOW FEVER COUNCIL
HENRY R. CARTER, M.D. HIDEYO NOGUCHI, M.D. JOSEPH H. WHITE, M.D.
August 19, 1925
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
You will be interested in the comments on yellow
fever transmission experiments made by Dr. Noguchi in his
letter of August 18, 1925. A copy is enclosed for your
information.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F F Russell Dr. Henry R. Carter
2122 California St., N.W.
Washington, D.C.
FRR:EP E
